sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都含有"客人，访问者"之意。
means: guest ： 多指事先受到激请而来，并受到欢迎与招待的宾客。也可指付钱居住者。
visitor ： 普通用词，指出差、访问、旅游、参观或到旅馆投宿的人。
passenger ： 主要指乘坐交通工具的游人或旅客。
customer ： 主要指交易一方的买主、主顾。
client与customer同义，多指进入商店被店员接待或购物的人。

sentence.Network_en: The duke was surprised by his wife's omission from the guest list.
sentence.Network_cn: 公爵对他的夫人未在获邀宾客之列感到意外。

sentence.Network_en: Murray was a guest on a live radio show.
sentence.Network_cn: 默里在一个直播的电台节目里当嘉宾。

sentence.Network_en: The boy's room is a complete contrast to the guest room.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个男孩的房间和客房截然不同。

lj.lj_ly: ‘May I choose the restaurant?’‘Be my guest!’.

jx.jx_en_mean: the most important guest at an occasion

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse gestr, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch gast and German Gast, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin hostis 'enemy' (originally 'stranger')

encyclopedia.content: Guest原意是“客人”、“旅客”、“访客”的意思。在计算机中，Guest是指让给客人访问电脑系统的帐户。在Windows XP操作系统中称之为“来宾帐户”。与“Administrator”和“User”不同的，通常这个帐户没有修改系统设置和进行安装程序的权限，也没有创建修改任何文档的权限，只能是读取计算机系统信息和文件。由于黑客和病毒的原因，一般情况下是不推荐使用此帐户，最好是不要开启这个帐户。 其复数加s，变为Guests 本文介绍 Micr

entry.def: A guest is someone who is visiting you or is at an event because you have invited them.

example.ex: She was a guest at the wedding...
Their guests sipped drinks on the veranda.
example.tran: 他们的客人在游廊里浅酌着美酒。

entry.def: A guest is someone who visits a place or organization or appears on a radio or television show because they have been invited to do so.

example.tran: 经常出现在访谈节目中的特邀嘉宾

example.ex: Dr Gerald Jeffers is the guest speaker...
example.tran: 杰拉尔德·杰弗斯博士是特邀演讲人。

entry.def: A guest is someone who is staying in a hotel.

example.ex: I was the only hotel guest...
example.tran: 我是宾馆里唯一的住客。

example.ex: Hotels operate a collection service for their guests from the airports.
example.tran: 宾馆为客人提供机场接机服务。

entry.tran: 做特邀嘉宾；做特邀演员；客串
entry.def: To guest means to take part in a performance or a match as a guest, rather than as a regular member.

example.ex: He guested for one or two League sides...
example.tran: 他在一两支联赛队伍中做过外援。

example.ex: The band have recently guested on records by Ringo Starr and Tears For Fears.
example.tran: 这个乐队最近在林戈·斯塔尔和“恐惧之泪”乐队的唱片中客串过。

entry.def: If you say be my guest to someone, you are giving them permission to do something.

example.ex: If anybody wants to work on this, be my guest.
example.tran: 如果哪位想干这个，请便。

means.word_mean: 1. a visitor to whom hospitality is extended
2. a customer of a hotel or restaurant etc.
3. (computer science) any computer that is hooked up to a computer network

stems_affixes.word_buile: guest客人→n.客人,宾客 v. 款待;做客
guest客人+house房子→n.上等旅社, 宾馆
guest客人→n.客人,宾客 v. 款待;做客

Sentence.sentence: Hosts and guests were matched up by Airbnb, a firm based in San Francisco.
I think he'll be good with the guests at the front desk.
The curtains were never drawn, even at night, so guests got a view of the lake and fountains outside which were lit up at night – a very attractive sight
As you can see, ladies and gentlemen, the guests were seated very informally around this oval table, which would add to the relaxed atmosphere.

sentences.en: They are coming to the concert as my guests.
sentences.cn: 他们作为我的客人出席音乐会。

sentences.en: Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome tonight's special guest.
sentences.cn: 女士们, 先生们, 请大家欢迎今晚的特邀嘉宾。

jushi.english: The sudden arrival of guests forced her to change her plans.
jushi.chinese: 客人们的突然来到迫使她改变了计划。

jushi.english: He is an unexpected guest to her.
jushi.chinese: 对于她来说,他可是位不速之客。

jushi.english: She welcomed her guests in a gracious manner.
jushi.chinese: 她以亲切的态度欢迎客人。
